data.name: tip0
data.value: Boggy ground significantly reduces a vehicle's turning speed and mobility.

data.name: tip1
data.value: To select shells, use keys 1–3.

data.name: tip10
data.value: Artillery is your team's primary firepower. Protect your SPGs, or they will be easy targets for the enemy.

data.name: tip100
data.value: The higher the skills of the Gunner, the faster the sight locks onto the target.

data.name: tip101
data.value: The higher the skills of the Commander, the better the whole crew will perform.

data.name: tip102
data.value: A skilled Driver makes more effective use of engine power.

data.name: tip103
data.value: A skilled Loader will load shells faster.

data.name: tip104
data.value: The Commander's training level influences the vehicle’s view range.

data.name: tip105
data.value: A skilled Radio Operator is able to communicate over longer distances.

data.name: tip106
data.value: Additional equipment improves crew efficiency or vehicle characteristics.

data.name: tip107
data.value: Vehicles with all technical branches researched acquire Elite status.

data.name: tip108
data.value: Combat Experience earned on Elite vehicles can be converted to Free Experience.

data.name: tip109
data.value: Elite vehicle status does not depend on crew skills.

data.name: tip11
data.value: Use bushes and foliage to make your tank destroyer harder to detect. Note that stationary vehicles are less visible.

data.name: tip110
data.value: Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake. It's impolite!

data.name: tip111
data.value: Sometimes capturing a base is the easiest and safest option. Destroying all enemies will not earn you any extra bonuses.

data.name: tip112
data.value: Destroyed vehicles are locked through the end of the battle. You can return to the Garage and join a new battle in another vehicle.

data.name: tip113
data.value: In Tank Company and clan battles, 50% of the credits and experience earned in battle by the defeated team is transferred to the winning team.

data.name: tip114
data.value: Sharing an account violates the game rules and can result in loss of access to the account.

data.name: tip115
data.value: The game rules forbid sharing accounts. Violators may lose both accounts forever.

data.name: tip116
data.value: The more sophisticated your password is, the better.

data.name: tip117
data.value: Change your password from time to time.

data.name: tip118
data.value: Game rules forbid purchasing and selling accounts. If you violate these rules, you could lose your account.

data.name: tip119
data.value: Do not follow links to unfamiliar websites. You risk being scammed or hacked.

data.name: tip12
data.value: Do not wait for the enemy on a friendly base. Pressing the attack may be more effective than base defense.

data.name: tip120
data.value: You can purchase gold only on the official World of Tanks website. If you try to purchase gold on other websites, you will only lose your money.

data.name: tip121
data.value: The option "Save password" is convenient but potentially insecure.

data.name: tip122
data.value: On the portal you can find the instructions on how to keep your account secure. Read them carefully.

data.name: tip123
data.value: Hold CTRL to display the mouse cursor.

data.name: tip124
data.value: To repair a module, click on the Repair Kit. To heal a crew member, click on the First Aid Kit.

data.name: tip125
data.value: Use hotkeys (1-6 by default) to activate consumables. Hotkeys are indicated above the consumables icons.

data.name: tip126
data.value: To move the camera instantly in Artillery mode, right-click on the minimap.

data.name: tip127
data.value: To change team list appearance, press CTRL+TAB.

data.name: tip128
data.value: Right-click the player's name in the side team panels to view possible actions.

data.name: tip129
data.value: To complain about the player, right-click the player's name in the side team panels and select the corresponding option from the context menu.

data.name: tip13
data.value: Even heavy tanks need backup.

data.name: tip130
data.value: The set of available commands in the Command Menu changes depending on whether your cursor is on an ally, an enemy, or a point of terrain.

data.name: tip14
data.value: Auto-Aim does not guarantee 100% accuracy. Experienced players use manual aim.

data.name: tip15
data.value: Some vehicles are best at evasive maneuvering, while others excel at staying undetected.

data.name: tip16
data.value: Caliber is not the only gauge of gun performance. Rate of fire and accuracy are also important.

data.name: tip17
data.value: A well-armored target that cannot be defeated with Armor Piercing shells can be quite vulnerable to High-Explosive shells.

data.name: tip18
data.value: Zigzag maneuvers help light and medium tanks dodge enemy shells.

data.name: tip19
data.value: Even the most heavily armored vehicle has its weak points: the sides and rear.

data.name: tip2
data.value: Light tanks are scouts. Use them to spot enemy vehicles for your teammates.

data.name: tip20
data.value: To mount some modules, you will need to replace your vehicle's suspension.

data.name: tip21
data.value: Some guns might require mounting another turret.

data.name: tip22
data.value: Different vehicles of the same type may require different battle tactics.

data.name: tip23
data.value: Light tanks and SPGs can be destroyed by ramming.

data.name: tip24
data.value: Aimed shots are more effective than uncontrolled firing.

data.name: tip25
data.value: Use High-Explosive shells to destroy modules and put enemy crew out of action.

data.name: tip26
data.value: Vehicles that are intended for close-range maneuvers are ineffective at long-range combat.

data.name: tip27
data.value: Shell types differ in penetration, damage, and burst radius.

data.name: tip28
data.value: High-Explosive shells are most effective against light tanks and SPGs with open cabins.

data.name: tip29
data.value: To stop an enemy vehicle and make it an easy target, shoot it in the tracks.

data.name: tip3
data.value: The longer light tanks manage to survive among enemies, the more successful artillery performance will be, and the more targets will be knocked out.

data.name: tip30
data.value: A low profile makes a vehicle harder to detect, especially in bushes.

data.name: tip31
data.value: Use AP Composite-Rigid shells when Armor Piercing shells are ineffective.

data.name: tip32
data.value: Additional perks and skills become available after training your crew to 100% in their major qualification.

data.name: tip33
data.value: A stationary vehicle is more difficult to detect than one in motion.

data.name: tip34
data.value: Combat Experience earned on Premium vehicles can be converted to Free Experience.

data.name: tip35
data.value: When using chat, make your messages constructive, worthwhile, and to the point.

data.name: tip36
data.value: In close combat, an SPG can destroy an enemy vehicle by direct fire.

data.name: tip37
data.value: Enemy artillery can guess your location when you knock down trees or destroy fences and structures.

data.name: tip38
data.value: Light tanks are good scouts. You can spot enemy vehicles using quick maneuvers or by remaining stationary behind bushes.

data.name: tip39
data.value: It always makes sense to concentrate fire.

data.name: tip4
data.value: A light tank without a good radio becomes a burden to the team.

data.name: tip40
data.value: Protect your artillery. SPGs can destroy enemy heavy tanks before they capture a friendly base.

data.name: tip41
data.value: To locate enemy vehicles, observe the trajectory of tracers.

data.name: tip42
data.value: The more vehicles inside the enemy base circle, the faster the base will be captured.

data.name: tip43
data.value: A draw means that both teams lose, except for Assault mode, where the defending team wins when battle time expires.

data.name: tip44
data.value: Dodge enemy shells when capturing the base. Base capture is interrupted if your vehicle is damaged.

data.name: tip45
data.value: Maneuverability is determined by the type of suspension, engine power, and total weight of mounted modules.

data.name: tip46
data.value: The chance of fire depends on engine type. The chance of putting the fire out depends on the skills of the crew and Fire Extinguishers.

data.name: tip47
data.value: Buildings and destroyed vehicles can block enemy fire. Trees and bushes may conceal you, but they will not block incoming shells.

data.name: tip48
data.value: When damaged, a turret locks up. Click on Repair Kit to restore turret rotation speed.

data.name: tip49
data.value: When damaged, a gun locks up. Click on Repair Kit to make the gun function with full accuracy.

data.name: tip5
data.value: The suspension, radio, and engine are generally more important to a light tank than the gun and turret.

data.name: tip50
data.value: Damage to the ammo rack may result in reduced loading speed, or, in some cases, immediate detonation.

data.name: tip51
data.value: A damaged observation device considerably reduces view range.

data.name: tip52
data.value: Rate of fire is affected by the gun type, turret, and the skills of the crew.

data.name: tip53
data.value: Injury to the Driver reduces the speed and maneuverability of a vehicle.

data.name: tip54
data.value: Loading speed is reduced when the Loader sustains an injury.

data.name: tip55
data.value: Firing accuracy is reduced when the Gunner is injured.

data.name: tip56
data.value: In addition to experience and credits, a Premium Account also gets you a nice clean Garage.

data.name: tip57
data.value: You can use Free Experience to research any vehicle or module.

data.name: tip58
data.value: When researching modules and vehicles, Combat Experience is spent first, while Free Experience is spent last.

data.name: tip59
data.value: A new module may be too heavy. To enhance load capacity, upgrade the suspension.

data.name: tip6
data.value: Vehicles of different types often require different tactics.

data.name: tip60
data.value: Credits and experience are awarded for spotting, damaging, and destroying enemy vehicles.

data.name: tip61
data.value: An empty ammo rack does not explode. Detonation of the ammo rack does not depend on shell type.

data.name: tip62
data.value: Your shots can reduce the hit points of an enemy vehicle, damage or destroy modules, or injure crew members.

data.name: tip63
data.value: Large High-Explosive shells have tremendous destructive power. It is possible to damage several vehicles with one shot.

data.name: tip64
data.value: APCR and HEAT shells have the highest penetration.

data.name: tip65
data.value: Make use of terrain irregularities, as they can provide refuge from direct fire and observation.

data.name: tip66
data.value: A well-coordinated team is a winning team.

data.name: tip67
data.value: If you are running out of space in your Garage, consider selling an old vehicle or purchasing another slot.

data.name: tip68
data.value: Use the Depot to sell vehicles, modules, or ammo you don't need.

data.name: tip69
data.value: If anyone asks for your password, it's a scam. Administrators will never need your password for any reason. Always keep your password private.

data.name: tip7
data.value: The goal of a medium tank is to attack flanks and rear areas, and withdraw after delivering a thrust.

data.name: tip70
data.value: Premium vehicles are cheap to repair.

data.name: tip71
data.value: Do not fire at your allies!

data.name: tip72
data.value: Your radio's signal power determines your ability to exchange information about enemy positions.

data.name: tip73
data.value: View range is the maximum distance at which you can locate the enemy.

data.name: tip74
data.value: The higher your vehicle's speed, the lower your accuracy.

data.name: tip75
data.value: Traversing your turret and hull reduces your firing accuracy, so after a maneuver is complete, wait for the aiming circle to snap onto the target.

data.name: tip76
data.value: Penetration parameters of High-Explosive and HEAT shells do not depend on firing range.

data.name: tip77
data.value: Top speed is determined by the suspension. Acceleration depends on engine power, vehicle weight, and the type of terrain.

data.name: tip78
data.value: The suspension's crossing capacity is affected by different terrain.

data.name: tip79
data.value: Effective ramming is determined by the ratio of weight, speed, and armor thickness of the vehicles.

data.name: tip8
data.value: A wolf pack of medium tanks is capable of hounding even the strongest opponent to death.

data.name: tip80
data.value: It is always tougher to penetrate frontal armor. Aim at the sides and rear.

data.name: tip81
data.value: The speed the sight snaps to the target is determined by the gun type and Gunner skills.

data.name: tip82
data.value: Injury to the Commander decreases View Range.

data.name: tip83
data.value: Auto-Aim turns off if the tracked target is destroyed or lost.

data.name: tip84
data.value: A destroyed vehicle is locked and remains in the Garage until the end of the battle.

data.name: tip85
data.value: You can only enter a battle with a fully repaired vehicle and a full-strength crew.

data.name: tip86
data.value: Check "Resupply automatically" to reload ammunition to the vehicle's pre-battle quantities.

data.name: tip87
data.value: Sloped armor increases the chances of a ricochet.

data.name: tip88
data.value: You can enlarge your Barracks if needed.

data.name: tip89
data.value: You can transfer crew members to another vehicle or send them to the Barracks.

data.name: tip9
data.value: Whenever you sense danger, relocate your SPG—you'll survive longer.

data.name: tip90
data.value: An injured crew member receives less experience in battle.

data.name: tip91
data.value: You cannot start a battle with an incomplete crew.

data.name: tip92
data.value: The speed of your crew's advancement depends on their success in battle.

data.name: tip93
data.value: The Commander can boost major qualifications of the other crew members.

data.name: tip94
data.value: Major qualification of a crew member can be changed for gold. The nation of a crew member is unchangeable.

data.name: tip95
data.value: All Combat Experience earned with the enabled Accelerate crew training mode is spent on upgrading crew skills.

data.name: tip96
data.value: Training your crew to 100% in their major qualification unlocks additional skills and perks.

data.name: tip97
data.value: Crew members can master different skills and perks.

data.name: tip98
data.value: The list of equipment available depends on the vehicle's type and nationality.

data.name: tip99
data.value: Some equipment can be demounted and transferred to another vehicle.

data.name: tip131
data.value: To select a command in the Command Menu, hold Z and move your mouse to highlight the desired command.

data.name: tip132
data.value: Use the F2–F8 hotkeys to quickly select commands in the Command Menu.

data.name: tip133
data.value: Use right Shift + "+" and right Shift + "-" to change dynamic resolution of the screen in a battle.

data.name: tip134
data.value: Being rude is not the best way to convince your ally that you are right. Besides, it is not allowed by the game rules.

data.name: tip135
data.value: Allies are most willing to support polite players.

data.name: tip136
data.value: The main battle must take place on the map, not in chat.

data.name: tip137
data.value: Do not send non-informative messages to the chat because they distract players from battle.

data.name: tip138
data.value: Use the Complain option when any of the game rules are violated.

data.name: tip139
data.value: By adding players to the Blacklist you will stop receiving messages and invitations from them immediately.

data.name: tip140
data.value: Message censorship can be enabled in Settings.

data.name: tip141
data.value: Battle chat can be disabled in Settings. Platoon chat will still be available.

data.name: tip142
data.value: While you are having quarrels with your allies, the enemy stays alert.

data.name: tip143
data.value: Keep track of the battle course. Even one mistake can lead to defeat.

data.name: tip144
data.value: When using forbidden programs or fighting fixed battles, you are at risk of losing your account irrevocably.

data.name: tip145
data.value: Each hit on allies is registered by a special system that will sooner or later lock the gunner automatically.

data.name: tip146
data.value: Game rules violations are punishable and may result in locking your account.

data.name: tip147
data.value: If you were punished for the Game rules violation, we strongly recommend you to re-read them in order to prevent such incidents in future.

data.name: tip148
data.value: The Game rules apply to all players, as does the responsibility for violating them.

data.name: tip149
data.value: Free gold and cheat-codes are just tricks used to steal your account.

data.name: tip150
data.value: Never use your in-game email and password on other websites. You could lose your account.

data.name: tip151
data.value: The option "Remember password" is convenient but potentially insecure.

data.name: tip152
data.value: To designate a target for your allies, hold Z and select "Requesting fire!" while aiming at the enemy.

data.name: tip153
data.value: A secure mailbox increases the security of your account.

data.name: tip154
data.value: Do not forget to keep your mailbox secure so that hackers cannot use it to steal your account.

data.name: tip155
data.value: On the portal you can find the instructions how to keep your account secure. Read them carefully.

data.name: tip156
data.value: Always make sure that you are logging in to the official World of Tanks website. Fake websites can be disguised as the official site.

data.name: tip157
data.value: Never accept presents from unknown people. It may result in locking your account.

data.name: tip158
data.value: Hold CTRL to display the mouse cursor.

data.name: tip159
data.value: Mouse cursor can be displayed by holding CTRL.

data.name: tip160
data.value: To repair a module or heal a crew member, click on the appropriate icon at the bottom left of the screen.

data.name: tip161
data.value: To repair a damaged module, click on the repair kit at the bottom of the screen and select the module.

data.name: tip162
data.value: To heal an injured crew member, click on the First Aid Kit at the bottom of the screen and select the crew member.

data.name: tip163
data.value: Use hotkeys (1-6 by default) to activate consumables. Hotkeys are indicated above the consumables icons.

data.name: tip164
data.value: To move a camera instantly, right-click on the minimap in the artillery mode.

data.name: tip165
data.value: To change team list appearance, press CTRL+TAB.

data.name: tip166
data.value: To add a player to the Friends list, Ignore list or send a complaint, right-click on the player's name in the team list.

data.name: tip167
data.value: To add a player to the Friends list, right-click on his name in the team list and select Add to your Friends list.

data.name: tip168
data.value: To send a complaint, right-click on his name in the team list and select "Complain".

data.name: tip169
data.value: If you notice that someone is insulting other players, right-click on his name and select Complain > Insult and provocation.

data.name: tip170
data.value: Press and hold Z to send commands to other players on your team.

data.name: tip171
data.value: The set of available commands in the Radial Menu depends on your target.

data.name: tip172
data.value: To select the command in the Radial Menu, hold Z and move your mouse to highlight the desired command.

data.name: tip173
data.value: The "Reloading!" message informs your allies that you're unable to shoot at the moment.

data.name: tip174
data.value: Use the F2–F8 hotkeys to quickly select commands in the Radial Menu.

data.name: tip175
data.value: To make a request of an ally, aim at the allied vehicle, press and hold Z, and select desired command.

data.name: tip_football
data.value: Vehicles cannot be damaged, but their tracks can be damaged. Victory conditions: score 3 goals or be in the lead at the end of the match.

data.name: eventTip
data.value: Repair shells can either repair allied vehicles or cause damage to enemy vehicles.

data.name: beCareful
data.value: Be Careful

data.name: followTheRules
data.value: Follow the Rules

data.name: payAttention
data.value: Pay Attention

data.name: security
data.value: Security Above Everything

data.name: technicalAdvice
data.value: Technical Advice

data.name: tip0/payAttention/tactics/0_50/all/all/all
data.value: Boggy ground significantly reduces a vehicle's speed and turning rate.

data.name: tip100/payAttention/crew/0_500/all/all/all
data.value: The higher the skill of the Gunner, the faster the sight snaps onto the target.

data.name: tip103/payAttention/crew/0_500/all/all/all
data.value: A skilled Loader will load shells faster.

data.name: tip106/payAttention/tactics/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Additional equipment improves crew efficiency and vehicle characteristics.

data.name: tip107/payAttention/economics/50_500/all/all/all
data.value: Vehicles with all modules and subsequent vehicles researched acquire the Elite status.

data.name: tip108/payAttention/tactics/200_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Combat Experience earned on Elite vehicles, including Premium vehicles, can be converted to Free Experience.

data.name: tip11/payAttention/tactics/0_infinity/AT-SPG/all/all
data.value: Use bushes and foliage to make your tank destroyer harder to detect. Note that stationary vehicles are less visible.

data.name: tip111/payAttention/tactics/50_500/all/all/all
data.value: Sometimes capturing a base is an easier and safer option than trying to destroy all enemy vehicles.

data.name: tip112/payAttention/economics/0_100/all/all/all
data.value: In Domination, you can drive up to three vehicles in a battle. When your vehicle is destroyed, select a new one and get back on the battlefield.

data.name: tip114/followTheRules/security/0_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Sharing an account violates the Game Rules and can result in loss of access to the account.

data.name: tip115/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: The Game Rules forbid sharing accounts. Violators may lose both accounts forever.

data.name: tip116/security/security/0_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: The more sophisticated your password is, the better.

data.name: tip117/security/security/0_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Change your password regularly.

data.name: tip118/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Game Rules forbid purchasing and selling accounts. If you violate these rules, you can lose your account.

data.name: tip119/security/security/0_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Do not follow links to unfamiliar websites. You risk being scammed or hacked.

data.name: tip120/security/security/0_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: You can purchase gold only on the official World of Tanks website. If you try to purchase gold on other websites, you run the risk of losing your money.

data.name: tip121/security/security/200_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: The Save password option is convenient but potentially insecure.

data.name: tip122/security/security/0_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: On the portal you can find instructions on how to keep your account secure. Read them carefully.

data.name: tip123/payAttention/tactics/200_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: While in battle, hold Ctrl to display the mouse cursor.

data.name: tip124/payAttention/tactics/50_500/all/all/all
data.value: To repair a module, use the Repair Kit. To heal a crew member, use the First Aid Kit.

data.name: tip125/usefulFeatures/interface/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: To use consumables and switch between shell types, use hotkeys (1–6 by default).

data.name: tip126/usefulFeatures/interface/100_500/SPG/all/all
data.value: To move the camera instantly in Artillery mode, right-click on the minimap.

data.name: tip127/usefulFeatures/interface/500_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: To change team list appearance, press Ctrl+Tab.

data.name: tip128/usefulFeatures/interface/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Right-click a player's name in the side team panels to view possible actions.

data.name: tip129/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: To complain about a player, right-click the player's name in the side team panels and select the corresponding option from the context menu.

data.name: tip130/usefulFeatures/interface/500_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: The set of available commands in the Command Menu changes depending on whether your cursor is on an ally, an enemy, or a point of terrain.

data.name: tip131/usefulFeatures/interface/200_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: To select a command in the Command Menu, hold Z and move your mouse to highlight the desired command.

data.name: tip132/usefulFeatures/interface/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Use the F2–F8 hotkeys to quickly select commands in the Command Menu.

data.name: tip134/followTheRules/rules/200_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Being rude is not the best way to convince your ally that you are right. Besides, it is not allowed by the Game Rules.

data.name: tip135/followTheRules/rules/200_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Allies are most willing to support polite players.

data.name: tip136/followTheRules/rules/200_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: The main battle must take place on the map, not in chat.

data.name: tip137/followTheRules/rules/200_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Do not send non-informative messages in chat; they distract players from the battle.

data.name: tip138/followTheRules/rules/200_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Use the Complain option when any of the Game Rules are violated.

data.name: tip139/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: By adding players to the Blacklist you will stop receiving messages and invitations from them immediately.

data.name: tip14/payAttention/tactics/101_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Auto-Aim does not guarantee 100% accuracy. Experienced players use manual aim.

data.name: tip140/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Message censorship can be enabled in Settings.

data.name: tip141/followTheRules/rules/200_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Battle chat can be disabled in Settings. Platoon chat will still be available.

data.name: tip142/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: While you are quarreling with your allies, the enemy is taking control of the battlefield.

data.name: tip143/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Keep track of the flow of the battle. Just one mistake can lead to defeat.

data.name: tip144/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Using forbidden mods or engaging in collusion puts you at risk of losing your account permanently.

data.name: tip145/followTheRules/rules/0_500/all/all/all
data.value: Each hit on allies is registered by an automatic system; repeated hits on allies will lead to a temporary ban.

data.name: tip146/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Game Rules violations are punishable and may result in locking of your account.

data.name: tip147/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: If you were punished for a Game Rules violation, we strongly recommend that you reread the rules in order to prevent such incidents in future.

data.name: tip148/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: The Game Rules apply to all players, as do the penalties for violating them.

data.name: tip149/technicalAdvice/techProblems/500_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Cannot enter a battle? Try turning off mods and restarting the game client.

data.name: tip150/technicalAdvice/techProblems/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Low FPS rate? Try a lower graphics quality in Settings.

data.name: tip151/technicalAdvice/techProblems/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Low FPS rate and graphic distortions? Try updating your video card drivers.

data.name: tip152/technicalAdvice/techProblems/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: High latency when connecting via 3G or Wi-Fi? Try using a wired internet connection.

data.name: tip153/technicalAdvice/techProblems/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Your vehicle teleports or fires with a delay? Check your network connection.

data.name: tip154/technicalAdvice/techProblems/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Reliable antivirus software guarantees stable operation of your hardware and game client.

data.name: tip155/technicalAdvice/techProblems/500_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Your team is unable to hear you in a battle? Check your voice communication settings.

data.name: tip156/technicalAdvice/techProblems/200_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: The more details you give in describing the issue to the Customer Service Center, the more promptly your issue will be considered.

data.name: tip157/technicalAdvice/techProblems/200_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Before contacting the Customer Service Center, make sure the issue can be reproduced with game mods off.

data.name: tip158/security/security/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Adding your phone number to your account profile makes your account secure from potential hacking.

data.name: tip159/security/security/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Make sure the mobile phone number you added to your account is active. This will allow prompt restoration of access to your account.

data.name: tip160/security/security/0_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Make sure your email is secure. Administrators do not change the email that is added to account.

data.name: tip161/security/security/0_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: If you suspect someone has gained unauthorized access to your account, contact the Customers Support Service right away.

data.name: tip162/security/security/0_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Do not accept gifts from unknown users.

data.name: tip163/security/security/0_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Select the correct section of the Customer Service Center to guarantee a prompt consideration of your issue.

data.name: tip164/payAttention/tactics/500_infinity/SPG/all/all
data.value: A skilled artillery player can use shell tracers to detect and destroy an enemy SPG that does not change its firing position.

data.name: tip165/payAttention/tactics/100_500/all/all/all
data.value: An Automatic Fire Extinguisher promptly extinguishes fire and also reduces the chance of engine fire.

data.name: tip166/payAttention/tactics/500_infinity/SPG/all/all
data.value: When driving an SPG, remember to account for shell flight path and speed, as well as terrain irregularities.

data.name: tip167/payAttention/tactics/50_500/all/all/all
data.value: Keep track of your allies and enemies on the Minimap.

data.name: tip168/payAttention/tactics/500_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Firing during passive spotting reveals your position. You earn additional experience and credits for spotting the enemy.

data.name: tip169/payAttention/tactics/500_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Use the Repair Kit for quick repair of damaged tracks. Once your vehicle is mobile, try to evade enemy shells.

data.name: tip17/payAttention/tactics/151_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: A well-armored target that cannot be defeated with Armor Piercing shells can still be damaged by High-Explosive shells.

data.name: tip170/payAttention/tactics/200_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Like bushes, fallen trees conceal your vehicles.

data.name: tip171/payAttention/tactics/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Boulders and deep trenches can immobilize your vehicle.

data.name: tip172/payAttention/economics/0_500/all/all/all
data.value: Premium ammunition and consumables can be purchased for gold by default.

data.name: tip173/payAttention/economics/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: You can transfer crew members to a Premium vehicle of the same nation and type without retraining.

data.name: tip174/payAttention/crew/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Injuries to crew members reduce their battle effectiveness.

data.name: tip175/payAttention/crew/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: The Brothers in Arms perk comes into effect only when it reaches 100% for all crew members.

data.name: tip176/payAttention/security/0_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: To receive your gift, the recipient player has to log in to their Account Management.

data.name: tip177/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Sanctions for destruction/damage to allied vehicles will not be subject to appeal, under any circumstances.

data.name: tip178/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Consult the Customer Service Center to clarify the reasons for suspension of your account.

data.name: tip179/beCareful/security/0_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Before sending the Customer Service Center a ticket for missing vehicles, make sure you have disabled the vehicle filter in the game client.

data.name: tip20/payAttention/economics/50_500/all/all/all
data.value: To mount some modules, you will need to replace your vehicle's suspension and turret.

data.name: tip23/payAttention/tactics/200_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Light vehicles with weak armor protection can be destroyed by ramming.

data.name: tip25/payAttention/tactics/151_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Use High-Explosive shells to destroy modules and knock out enemy crew.

data.name: tip28/payAttention/tactics/500_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: High-Explosive shells are most effective against vehicles with weak armor protection and with open cabins.

data.name: tip29/payAttention/tactics/0_50/all/all/all
data.value: To stop an enemy vehicle and make it an easy target, shoot it in the tracks.

data.name: tip30/payAttention/tactics/201_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: A low profile makes a vehicle harder to detect, especially in bushes.

data.name: tip31/payAttention/tactics/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Use AP Composite-Rigid or HE Anti-Tank shells when Armor Piercing shells are ineffective.

data.name: tip32/payAttention/crew/0_500/all/all/all
data.value: Additional perks and skills become available after training your crew to 100% in their major qualification.

data.name: tip33/payAttention/tactics/51_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: A stationary vehicle is more difficult to detect than one in motion.

data.name: tip36/payAttention/tactics/101_infinity/SPG/all/all
data.value: In close combat, an SPG can destroy an enemy vehicle by direct fire.

data.name: tip37/payAttention/tactics/100_500/all/all/all
data.value: Enemy artillery can guess your location when you destroy fences and structures.

data.name: tip39/payAttention/tactics/0_100/all/all/all
data.value: It always makes sense to concentrate fire.

data.name: tip41/payAttention/tactics/51_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: To detect enemy vehicles, observe the trajectory of tracers.

data.name: tip42/payAttention/tactics/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: The more vehicles inside the enemy base circle, the faster the base will be captured. The fastest capture can be achieved by three vehicles.

data.name: tip43/payAttention/tactics/500_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: If neither team achieves superiority in the Assault mode, the defending team wins when battle time expires.

data.name: tip44/payAttention/tactics/0_100/all/all/all
data.value: Dodge enemy shells when capturing the base. Base capture is interrupted if your vehicle is damaged.

data.name: tip45/payAttention/tactics/50_150/all/all/all
data.value: Maneuverability is affected by the type of suspension, engine power, and total weight of mounted modules.

data.name: tip47/payAttention/tactics/0_100/all/all/all
data.value: Buildings and destroyed vehicles can block enemy fire. Trees and bushes may conceal you, but they will not block incoming shells.

data.name: tip48/payAttention/tactics/50_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Click on Repair Kit to repair a damaged module.

data.name: tip49/payAttention/tactics/50_200/all/all/all
data.value: When destroyed, a gun cannot fire. Use a Repair Kit to make the gun function again.

data.name: tip50/payAttention/tactics/50_200/all/all/all
data.value: Damage to the ammo rack may result in reduced loading speed, or, in some cases, immediate detonation.

data.name: tip56/payAttention/economics/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: In addition to experience and credits, a Premium Account also gets you a nice clean Garage.

data.name: tip57/payAttention/economics/500_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: You can use Free Experience to research any vehicle or module.

data.name: tip58/payAttention/economics/500_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: When researching modules and vehicles, Combat Experience is spent first, while Free Experience is spent last.

data.name: tip59/payAttention/economics/100_500/all/all/all
data.value: A new module may be too heavy. To enhance load capacity, upgrade the suspension.

data.name: tip6/payAttention/tactics/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Vehicles of different types often require different tactics.

data.name: tip60/payAttention/economics/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Credits and experience are awarded for spotting, damaging, and destroying enemy vehicles; for base capture/defense, etc.

data.name: tip62/payAttention/tactics/50_200/all/all/all
data.value: Your shots can reduce the hit points of an enemy vehicle, damage or destroy modules, or injure crew members.

data.name: tip65/payAttention/tactics/50_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Make use of terrain irregularities, as they can provide refuge from direct fire and observation.

data.name: tip66/payAttention/tactics/0_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: A well-coordinated team is a winning team.

data.name: tip67/payAttention/economics/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: If you are running out of space in your Garage, consider selling an old vehicle or purchasing another slot.

data.name: tip68/payAttention/economics/500_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Use the Depot to sell vehicles, modules, consumables, equipment, or ammo you do not need.

data.name: tip69/security/security/0_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: If anyone asks for your password, it is a scam. Administrators will never need your password for any reason. Always keep your password private.

data.name: tip70/payAttention/economics/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Premium vehicles are cheap to repair.

data.name: tip71/followTheRules/rules/0_500/all/all/all
data.value: Do not fire at your allies!

data.name: tip75/payAttention/tactics/0_200/all/all/all
data.value: Traversing your turret and hull reduces your firing accuracy, so after a maneuver is complete, wait for the aiming circle to snap onto the target.

data.name: tip78/payAttention/tactics/500_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Suspension modules have different traverse speed, crossing ability, and loading capacity.

data.name: tip79/payAttention/tactics/200_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Effective ramming is determined by the ratio of weight, speed, and armor thickness of the vehicles.

data.name: tip81/payAttention/crew/0_500/all/all/all
data.value: The speed with which the sight snaps to the target is determined by the gun type and the Gunner's skills.

data.name: tip83/payAttention/tactics/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Auto-Aim turns off if the tracked target is destroyed or lost.

data.name: tip84/payAttention/economics/0_100/all/all/all
data.value: A destroyed vehicle is locked and remains unavailable in the Garage until the end of the battle.

data.name: tip85/payAttention/economics/0_100/all/all/all
data.value: You can only enter a battle with a fully repaired vehicle and a complete crew.

data.name: tip86/payAttention/economics/0_500/all/all/all
data.value: You may check the Resupply Automatically and Repair Automatically options for your vehicle.

data.name: tip87/payAttention/tactics/200_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: Sloped armor increases the chances of ricochets and non-penetrating hits.

data.name: tip88/payAttention/economics/0_500/all/all/all
data.value: You can enlarge your Barracks if needed.

data.name: tip89/payAttention/economics/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: You can transfer crew members to another vehicle or send them to the Barracks.

data.name: tip9/payAttention/tactics/0_infinity/SPG/all/all
data.value: Whenever you sense danger, relocate your SPG—you will survive longer.

data.name: tip90/payAttention/crew/0_500/all/all/all
data.value: An injured crew member receives 10% less experience per battle.

data.name: tip91/payAttention/economics/0_100/all/all/all
data.value: You cannot start a battle with an incomplete crew.

data.name: tip92/payAttention/crew/0_500/all/all/all
data.value: The speed of your crew's training depends on their success in battle.

data.name: tip93/payAttention/crew/100_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: The Commander boosts the major qualifications of the other crew members.

data.name: tip95/payAttention/crew/200_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: All Combat Experience earned with Accelerate Crew Training enabled is received by the least-skilled crew member.

data.name: tip99/payAttention/economics/200_infinity/all/all/all
data.value: All equipment can be demounted and transferred to another vehicle.

data.name: usefulFeatures
data.value: Useful Options

data.name: tip0/payAttention/tactics/0_50/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Boggy ground significantly reduces a vehicle's speed and turning rate.

data.name: tip100/payAttention/crew/0_500/all/all/all/all
data.value: The higher the skill of the Gunner, the faster the sight snaps onto the target.

data.name: tip103/payAttention/crew/0_500/all/all/all/all
data.value: A skilled Loader will load shells faster.

data.name: tip106/payAttention/tactics/100_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Additional equipment improves crew efficiency and vehicle characteristics.

data.name: tip107/payAttention/economics/50_500/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Vehicles with all modules and subsequent vehicles researched acquire Elite status.

data.name: tip108/payAttention/tactics/200_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Combat Experience earned on Elite vehicles, including Premium vehicles, can be converted to Free Experience.

data.name: tip11/payAttention/tactics/0_infinity/except_7/AT-SPG/all/all
data.value: Use bushes and foliage to make your tank destroyer harder to detect. Note that stationary vehicles are less visible.

data.name: tip111/payAttention/tactics/50_500/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Sometimes capturing a base is an easier and safer option than trying to destroy all enemy vehicles.

data.name: tip112/payAttention/economics/0_100/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: The Rampage mode has many unique features and significantly differs from other battle modes.

data.name: tip114/followTheRules/security/0_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Sharing an account violates the Game Rules and can result in loss of access to the account.

data.name: tip115/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: The Game Rules forbid sharing accounts. Violators may lose both accounts forever.

data.name: tip116/security/security/0_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: The more sophisticated your password is, the better.

data.name: tip117/security/security/0_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Change your password regularly.

data.name: tip118/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Game Rules forbid purchasing and selling accounts. If you violate these rules, you can lose your account.

data.name: tip119/security/security/0_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Do not trust links to unfamiliar websites.

data.name: tip120/security/security/0_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: You can only purchase gold on the official World of Tanks website. If you try to purchase gold from other websites, you run the risk of losing your money.

data.name: tip121/security/security/200_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: The Save password option is convenient but potentially unsafe.

data.name: tip122/security/security/0_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: On the portal, you can find instructions about how to keep your account secure. Please read them carefully.

data.name: tip123/payAttention/tactics/200_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: While in battle, hold CTRL to display the mouse cursor.

data.name: tip124/payAttention/tactics/50_500/all/all/all/all
data.value: To repair a module, use the Repair Kit. To heal a crew member, use the First Aid Kit.

data.name: tip125/usefulFeatures/interface/100_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: To use consumables and switch between shell types, use hotkeys (1–6 by default).

data.name: tip126/usefulFeatures/interface/100_500/except_7/SPG/all/all
data.value: To instantly move the camera in Artillery mode, right-click on the minimap.

data.name: tip127/usefulFeatures/interface/500_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: To change team list appearance, press CTRL+TAB.

data.name: tip128/usefulFeatures/interface/100_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Right-click a player's name in the side team panels to view possible actions.

data.name: tip129/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: To file a complaint about a player, right-click the player's name in the side team panels and select the corresponding option from the context menu.

data.name: tip130/usefulFeatures/interface/500_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: The set of available commands in the Command Menu changes depending on whether your cursor is on an ally, an enemy, or a point of terrain.

data.name: tip131/usefulFeatures/interface/200_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: To select a command in the Command Menu, hold Z and move your mouse to highlight the desired command.

data.name: tip132/usefulFeatures/interface/100_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Use the F4–F8 hotkeys to quickly select commands in the Command Menu.

data.name: tip134/followTheRules/rules/200_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Being rude is not the best way to convince your ally that you are right. In addition, it is against the Game Rules.

data.name: tip135/followTheRules/rules/200_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Allies are more willing to support polite players.

data.name: tip136/followTheRules/rules/200_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Settle your arguments on the battlefield, not in the game chat.

data.name: tip137/followTheRules/rules/200_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Do not send non-informative messages in the chat; they distract players from the battle.

data.name: tip138/followTheRules/rules/200_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Use the Complain option when any of the Game Rules are violated.

data.name: tip139/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: By adding players to the Blacklist you will immediately stop receiving messages and invitations from them.

data.name: tip14/payAttention/tactics/101_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Auto-Aim does not guarantee 100% accuracy. Experienced players use manual aim.

data.name: tip140/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Message censorship can be enabled in Settings.

data.name: tip141/followTheRules/rules/200_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Battle chat can be disabled in Settings. Platoon chat will still be available.

data.name: tip142/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: While you are arguing with your allies, the enemy is taking control of the battlefield.

data.name: tip143/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Keep track of the flow of the battle. Just one mistake can lead to defeat.

data.name: tip144/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Using forbidden mods or engaging in collusion puts you at risk of permanently losing your account.

data.name: tip145/followTheRules/rules/0_500/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Each hit on allies is registered by an automatic system; repeated hits on allies will lead to a temporary ban.

data.name: tip146/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Violations of the Game Rules are punishable and may result in your account being locked.

data.name: tip147/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: If you were punished for a violation of the Game Rules, we strongly recommend that you reread the rules in order to prevent such incidents in the future.

data.name: tip148/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: The Game Rules apply to all players, as do the penalties for violating them.

data.name: tip149/technicalAdvice/techProblems/500_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Cannot enter a battle? Try turning off mods and restarting the game client.

data.name: tip150/technicalAdvice/techProblems/100_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Low FPS? Try a lower graphics quality in Settings.

data.name: tip151/technicalAdvice/techProblems/100_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Low FPS and graphic distortions? Try updating your video card drivers.

data.name: tip152/technicalAdvice/techProblems/100_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: High latency when connecting via 3G or Wi-Fi? Try using a wired internet connection.

data.name: tip153/technicalAdvice/techProblems/100_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Your vehicle teleports or fires with a delay? Check your network connection.

data.name: tip154/technicalAdvice/techProblems/100_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Reliable antivirus software guarantees stable operation of your hardware and game client.

data.name: tip155/technicalAdvice/techProblems/500_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Your team is unable to hear you in a battle? Check your voice communication settings.

data.name: tip156/technicalAdvice/techProblems/200_infinity/all/all/all/all/all
data.value: The more details you give when describing the issue to the Customer Service Center, the more promptly your issue will be considered.

data.name: tip157/technicalAdvice/techProblems/200_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Before contacting the Customer Service Center, make sure the issue can be reproduced with game mods turned off.

data.name: tip158/security/security/100_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Adding your phone number to your account profile makes your account more secure from potential hacking.

data.name: tip159/security/security/100_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Make sure the mobile phone number you added to your account is active. This will allow prompt restoration of access to your account.

data.name: tip160/security/security/0_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: By linking your mobile phone number to your account, you can change the email address that the account is registered with.

data.name: tip161/security/security/0_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: If you suspect someone has gained unauthorized access to your account, contact the Customers Support Service right away.

data.name: tip162/security/security/0_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Do not accept gifts from unknown users.

data.name: tip163/security/security/0_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Select the correct section of the Customer Service Center to guarantee that your issue will be considered promptly.

data.name: tip164/payAttention/tactics/500_infinity/except_7/SPG/all/all
data.value: A skilled artillery player can use shell tracers to detect and destroy an enemy SPG that does not change its firing position.

data.name: tip165/payAttention/tactics/100_500/all/all/all/all
data.value: An Automatic Fire Extinguisher promptly extinguishes fire and reduces the chance of engine fire.

data.name: tip166/payAttention/tactics/500_infinity/all/SPG/all/all
data.value: When driving an SPG, remember to account for the shell's flight path and speed, as well as terrain irregularities.

data.name: tip167/payAttention/tactics/50_500/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Keep track of your allies and enemies on the Minimap.

data.name: tip168/payAttention/tactics/500_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Firing while passively spotting reveals your position. You earn additional experience and credits for spotting the enemy.

data.name: tip169/payAttention/tactics/500_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Use a Repair Kit for quick repair of damaged tracks. Once your vehicle is mobile, try to evade enemy shells.

data.value: A well-armored target that cannot be defeated with Armor Piercing shells can still be damaged by High-Explosive shells.

data.value: Like bushes, fallen trees conceal your vehicle.

data.name: tip171/payAttention/tactics/100_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Boulders and deep trenches can immobilize your vehicle.

data.name: tip172/payAttention/economics/0_500/all/all/all/all
data.value: Premium ammunition and consumables can be purchased for gold by default.

data.name: tip173/payAttention/economics/100_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: You can transfer crew members to a Premium vehicle of the same nation and type without retraining.

data.name: tip174/payAttention/crew/100_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Injuries to crew members reduce their battle effectiveness.

data.name: tip175/payAttention/crew/100_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: The Brothers in Arms perk only comes into effect when it reaches 100% for all crew members.

data.name: tip176/payAttention/security/0_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: To receive a gift you sent, the recipient player has to log in to their Account Management.

data.name: tip177/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Punishment for destruction of/damage to allied vehicles will not be subject to appeal, under any circumstances.

data.name: tip178/followTheRules/rules/100_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Consult the Customer Service Center to clarify the reasons for suspension of your account.

data.name: tip179/beCareful/security/0_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Before sending the Customer Service Center a ticket for missing vehicles, make sure you have disabled the vehicle filter in the game client.

data.name: tip20/payAttention/economics/50_500/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: To mount some modules, you will need to replace your vehicle's suspension and turret.

data.name: tip23/payAttention/tactics/200_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Light vehicles with weak armor protection can be destroyed by ramming.

data.name: tip25/payAttention/tactics/151_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Use High-Explosive shells to destroy modules and knock out enemy crew.

data.name: tip28/payAttention/tactics/500_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: High-Explosive shells are most effective against vehicles with weak armor protection and open cabins.

data.name: tip29/payAttention/tactics/0_50/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: To stop an enemy vehicle and make it an easy target, shoot it in the tracks.

data.name: tip30/payAttention/tactics/201_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: A low profile makes a vehicle harder to detect, especially in bushes.

data.name: tip31/payAttention/tactics/100_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Use AP Composite-Rigid or HE Anti-Tank shells when Armor Piercing shells are ineffective.

data.name: tip32/payAttention/crew/0_500/all/all/all/all
data.value: Additional perks and skills become available after training your crew to 100% in their major qualification.

data.name: tip33/payAttention/tactics/51_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: A stationary vehicle is more difficult to detect than a moving vehicle.

data.name: tip36/payAttention/tactics/101_infinity/except_7/SPG/all/all
data.value: In close combat, an SPG can destroy an enemy vehicle by direct fire.

data.name: tip37/payAttention/tactics/100_500/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Enemy artillery can guess your location when you destroy fences and structures.

data.name: tip39/payAttention/tactics/0_100/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: It always makes sense to concentrate fire.

data.name: tip41/payAttention/tactics/51_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: To detect enemy vehicles, observe the trajectory of tracers.

data.name: tip42/payAttention/tactics/100_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: The more vehicles inside the enemy base circle, the faster the base will be captured. The fastest capture can be achieved by three vehicles.

data.name: tip43/payAttention/tactics/500_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: If neither team achieves superiority in the Assault mode, the defending team wins when battle time expires.

data.name: tip44/payAttention/tactics/0_100/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Dodge enemy shells when capturing the base. Base capture is interrupted if your vehicle is damaged.

data.name: tip45/payAttention/tactics/50_150/except_7/all/all/all/all
data.value: Maneuverability is affected by the type of suspension, engine power, and total weight of mounted modules.

data.name: tip47/payAttention/tactics/0_100/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Buildings and destroyed vehicles can block enemy fire. Trees and bushes may conceal you, but they will not block incoming shells.

data.name: tip48/payAttention/tactics/50_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Use a Repair Kit to repair a damaged module.

data.name: tip49/payAttention/tactics/50_200/all/all/all/all
data.value: When destroyed, a gun cannot fire. Use a Repair Kit to make the gun function again.

data.name: tip50/payAttention/tactics/50_200/all/all/all/all
data.value: Damage to the ammo rack may result in reduced loading speed, or, in some cases, immediate detonation.

data.name: tip56/payAttention/economics/100_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: In addition to experience and credits, Premium Account also gets you a nice clean Garage.

data.name: tip57/payAttention/economics/500_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: You can use Free Experience to research any vehicle or module.

data.name: tip58/payAttention/economics/500_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: When researching modules and vehicles, Combat Experience is spent first, while Free Experience is spent last.

data.name: tip59/payAttention/economics/100_500/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: A new module may be too heavy. To enhance load capacity, upgrade the suspension.

data.name: tip6/payAttention/tactics/100_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Vehicles of different types often require different tactics.

data.name: tip60/payAttention/economics/100_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Credits and experience are awarded for spotting, damaging, and destroying enemy vehicles; for base capture/defense, etc.

data.name: tip62/payAttention/tactics/50_200/all/all/all/all
data.value: Your shots can reduce the hit points of an enemy vehicle, damage or destroy modules, or injure crew members.

data.name: tip65/payAttention/tactics/50_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Make use of terrain irregularities, as they can provide cover from direct fire and observation.

data.name: tip66/payAttention/tactics/0_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: A well-coordinated team is a winning team.

data.name: tip67/payAttention/economics/100_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: If you are running out of space in your Garage, consider purchasing another slot or selling one of your vehicles.

data.name: tip68/payAttention/economics/500_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Use the Depot to sell vehicles, modules, consumables, equipment, or ammo that you do not need.

data.name: tip69/security/security/0_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: If anyone asks for your password, it is a scam. Administrators will never need your password for any reason. Always keep your password private.

data.name: tip70/payAttention/economics/100_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Premium vehicles are cheap to repair.

data.name: tip71/followTheRules/rules/0_500/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Do not shoot your allies!

data.name: tip75/payAttention/tactics/0_200/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Traversing your turret and hull reduces your firing accuracy, so after a maneuver is complete, wait for the aiming circle to snap onto the target.

data.name: tip78/payAttention/tactics/500_infinity/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: Suspension modules have different traverse speeds, crossing abilities, and loading capacities.

data.name: tip79/payAttention/tactics/200_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Effective ramming is determined by the ratio between weight, speed, and armor thickness of the vehicles.

data.name: tip81/payAttention/crew/0_500/all/all/all/all
data.value: The speed with which the sight snaps to the target is determined by the gun type and the Gunner's skills.

data.name: tip83/payAttention/tactics/100_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Auto-Aim turns off if the tracked target is destroyed or lost.

data.name: tip84/payAttention/economics/0_100/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: A destroyed vehicle is locked and remains unavailable in the Garage until the end of the battle.

data.name: tip85/payAttention/economics/0_100/all/all/all/all
data.value: You can only enter a battle with a fully repaired vehicle and a complete crew.

data.name: tip86/payAttention/economics/0_500/all/all/all/all
data.value: You may check the Resupply Automatically and Repair Automatically options for your vehicle.

data.name: tip87/payAttention/tactics/200_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Sloped armor increases the chances of ricochets and non-penetrating hits.

data.name: tip88/payAttention/economics/0_500/all/all/all/all
data.value: You can enlarge your Barracks if needed.

data.name: tip89/payAttention/economics/100_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: You can transfer crew members to another vehicle or send them to the Barracks.

data.name: tip9/payAttention/tactics/0_infinity/except_7/SPG/all/all
data.value: Whenever you sense danger, relocate your SPG—you will survive longer.

data.name: tip90/payAttention/crew/0_500/except_7/all/all/all
data.value: An injured crew member receives 10% less experience in a battle.

data.name: tip91/payAttention/economics/0_100/all/all/all/all
data.value: You cannot start a battle with an incomplete crew.

data.name: tip92/payAttention/crew/0_500/all/all/all/all
data.value: The speed of your crew's training depends on their success in battle.

data.name: tip93/payAttention/crew/100_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: The Commander boosts the major qualifications of other crew members.

data.name: tip95/payAttention/crew/200_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: All Combat Experience earned with Accelerate Crew Training enabled is received by the least-skilled crew member.

data.name: tip99/payAttention/economics/200_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: All equipment can be demounted and transferred to another vehicle.

data.name: howToPlay
data.value: How to Play

data.name: sandbox01
data.value: You start at point 1 (for tanks and tank destroyers) or 2 (for SPGs). Apply everything you have learned in Battle Training to destroy the enemy and win.

data.name: sandbox02
data.value: You start in the green base with three options for beginning your attack. Choose the appropriate tactics to win the battle.

data.name: eventMessage
data.value: ++++ eventMessage ++++

data.name: eventTitle
data.value: ++++ eventTitle ++++

data.name: sandbox0
data.value: You spawn in area 1 (for tanks and tank destroyers) or 2 (for SPGs). Apply everything you have learned during battle training and claim victory.

data.name: sandbox1
data.value: You spawn at the green base, which gives you three options for starting the attack. Choose your tactics and try to secure victory.

data.name: tip180/technicalAdvice/interface/0_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: You can adjust the volume by using the Master Volume slider or changing the volume settings for your system.

data.name: tip181/technicalAdvice/interface/0_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Select your sound device—"2.0/2.1 Sound System" or "Headphones"—in sound settings for better sound positioning.

data.name: tip182/technicalAdvice/interface/0_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: For the best performance on low-end sound systems, use the "Laptop" preset.

data.name: tip183/technicalAdvice/interface/0_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: Use the night mode to reduce sharp sounds.

data.name: tip184/technicalAdvice/interface/0_infinity/all/all/all/all
data.value: You can select the Low frequency enhancement option, but the result will differ for different sound systems.

data.name: epicRandom/0/body
data.value: You may experience minor performance issues in this battle type.

data.name: epicRandom/0/title
data.value: Attention

data.name: ranked/0/body
data.value: Ranks I and V are permanent, while Ranks II, III, and IV can be lost. Vehicle ranks are permanent.

data.name: ranked/0/title
data.value: Ranks

data.name: ranked/1/body
data.value: Do not be disheartened if you lose a rank: at the end of a stage, you will receive a reward for your best rank achieved, not your current one.

data.name: ranked/1/title
data.value: Justice for All

data.name: ranked/10/body
data.value: You receive bonds for your success in Ranked Battles. Bonds can be exchanged for directives and improved equipment.

data.name: ranked/10/title
data.value: Bonds

data.name: ranked/11/body
data.value: You receive rewards for achieving each rank for the first time within a stage, as well as for completing a stage.

data.name: ranked/11/title
data.value: Awards

data.name: ranked/12/body
data.value: Vehicle ranks are not accrued for the account; they are earned for each vehicle separately. The total number of ranks is aggregated on the Leaderboard.

data.name: ranked/12/title
data.value: Vehicle Ranks

data.name: ranked/2/body
data.value: Vehicle ranks are unlimited. The more vehicle ranks you earn within a season, the higher the position on the Leaderboard you achieve.

data.name: ranked/2/title
data.value: Up and Onward

data.name: ranked/3/body
data.value: Keep track of the prime time: once it is over, Ranked Battles will become unavailable until the next day.

data.name: ranked/3/title
data.value: Prime Time

data.name: ranked/4/body
data.value: Note that the duration of each stage is limited. Keep an eye on the calendar and earn as many points as you can during a stage.

data.name: ranked/4/title
data.value: Time is Money

data.name: ranked/5/body
data.value: Stage duration is limited! Battle hard if you want to receive worthy rewards.

data.name: ranked/5/title
data.value: Timeline

data.name: ranked/6/body
data.value: When a season is over, follow the news on the game portal so you do not miss the date the next season begins.

data.name: ranked/6/title
data.value: Follow the News

data.name: ranked/7/body
data.value: The best players will earn a place on the Leaderboard. Players receive a rank point for each rank achieved. The more points you get, the higher your position and the better the reward.

data.name: ranked/7/title
data.value: Season Leaders

data.name: ranked/8/body
data.value: The top players will receive badges at the end of a season. A badge is a mark of pride for players, a symbol of their unequalled mastery.

data.name: ranked/8/title
data.value: Badges

data.name: ranked/9/body
data.value: The reward you receive at the end of a season depends on the League you reach. You earn points for each rank achieved. The more points you have, the higher your League.

data.name: ranked/9/title
data.value: Awards
